required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prediction of Hemodynamic Instability in Patients Undergoing Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Prediction of Hemodynamic Instability in Patients Undergoing Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Academisch Medisch Centrum - Universiteit van Amsterdam (AMC-UvA)

clinical_study.source: Academisch Medisch Centrum - Universiteit van Amsterdam (AMC-UvA)

brief_summary.textblock:
Intraoperative hypotension occurs often and is associated with adverse patient outcomes such as stroke, myocardial infarction and renal injury.
The aim of this study was to test the accuracy of a physiology-based machine-learning algorithm using continuous non-invasive measurement of the blood pressure waveform with the Nexfin® finger cuff during surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: three minutes prior to the hypotensive event
three minutes prior to the hypotensive event

intervention.description: The accurary of the Hypotension Probability Indicator (HPI) is tested in the created offline database. This means data was prospectively collected but the HPI algorithm was not tested prospectively but after collection in the offline database.

study_pop.textblock: All adult patients undergoing surgery in the AMC were included in the study. Subjects were only excluded when technical problems or strong local vasoconstriction (i.e., cold fingers) prevented the Nexfin® non-invasive blood pressure finger cuff measurement. Subjects were not excluded for any other reason besides technical failure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all adult patients undergoing surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
